summary.p: The Kācikāṇṭam, The book of Kāci, that is Kāśī (Benares), is a Tamil version of the Kāśīkhaṇḍa of the late version of the Sanskrit Skandapurāṇa. The Kācikāṇṭam is the work of the Teṉkāci (Southern Kāśī) king Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, who ruled in the second half of the 16th century. See Raghavan (1960, p. 235). On Ativīrarāmapāṇṭiyaṉ, best known for his Naiṭatam, a Tamil version of the Sanskrit Naiṣadha by Harṣa, see Shulman (2012, pp. 155ff.).
Paratexts: marginal benedictions, title-pages, invocation page, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statement, occasionally total stanzas, colophon.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (February 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

filiation.p: Bnf Indien 332 and 334; GOML D. 565‒566 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 549ff.).

extent.note: 365 mm is in fact the maximum breadth observed. Folios in U1‒U3 are conspicuously smaller in breadth, as are folios at the end of U4. The folios have been resized on purpose (sometimes at the cost of truncating the original foliation, e.g., first folios in U3), so as to give the bundle a specific shape.

15 folios = Kācikāṇṭam: Title Page & Table of Contents. Tamil foliation {1}, 2‒15.
1 folio = Kācikāṇṭam: Title Page. Tamil foliation {1}. In big letters, in Tamil.

267 folios = Kācikāṇṭam: Invocation & Text. Tamil foliation 1-268. Parallel Arabic foliation 1-246 for ff. 1‒247 (discrepancy due to the fact that there is no folio foliated 147 in Tamil, thus Tamil foliated 148 = Arabic foliated 147). Parallel Tamil foliation 1‒21, Roman numerals foliation I-XXI for ff. 248‒268.
1 folio = Kācikāṇṭam: Invocation. Parallel Tamil foliation 1 and Arabic foliation 1. Verso blank.
266 folios = Kācikāṇṭam: Text. Tamil foliation 2-268 and parallel foliations (see description of U4 above).

origin.origDate: See colophon, U4, f267r for the date 1739, most probably copied from the master copy. 1731 according to Cabaton (1912, p. 48), who probably misread the numeral "9" for "1".

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 80.

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
